thread.title: Eggslut, That Saucy LA Breakfast Staple, Lands a Cookbook Deal
thread.title_full: Eggslut, That Saucy LA Breakfast Staple, Lands a Cookbook Deal

author: Erin DeJesus
title: Eggslut, That Saucy LA Breakfast Staple, Lands a Cookbook Deal
text: Eggslut, That Saucy LA Breakfast Staple, Lands a Cookbook Deal And other restaurant news you should know right now Photo: T.Tseng/ Flickr • Eggslut founder Alvin Cailan built an entire empire upon yolk-dripping sandwiches, and now, the Los Angeles-based chef has landed a cookbook deal : Amboy will be published by Houghton Mifflin Harcourt and feature recipes borrowing from Cailan’s Filipino roots. “It's about sharing the Filipino tastes that flavored my childhood and the years spent learning who I am and what good food is,” he said in a press release. No release date for the book has been announced. • Construction is currently underway at René Redzepi’s upcoming Noma pop-up in Tulum, Mexico, where the $600 per person reservations are already sold out . “There is no existing infrastructure at all, no plumbing electricity or water,” write Redzepi and chef Rosio Sanchez of the open-air space. “We are bringing all of that in.” The team has eight weeks to throw it all together: Noma Mexico debuts April 12. • Meanwhile, an ex-Noma chef is also cashing in on Tulum’s cool factor, launching his own pop-up in the resort destination: Mads Refslund, who intrepid New York City diners will know from the Nordic-inflected Acme, will be a chef in residence at Gitano Tulum starting today. Courtesy Gitano Tulum • If you see lines already forming outside of Subway restaurants this morning, it’s because the sandwich chain is offering free six-inch subs with a large drink purchase all day. Happy Valentine’s Day, indeed. • Coffee mega-giant Starbucks announced today that it’s adding affogato (and other ice cream-based drinks) to menus at 100 locations nationwide. Sweet. • Worthy reading: If your morning drink is less espresso-based, more hair of the dog, Extra Crispy traces the origin of the clamato preparado , aka a bloody mary with clam juice.
